title: ABN AMRO Q2 profit increases
content:
(MarketLine via COMTEX News Network) -- ABN AMRO Bank N.V. has reported that profit for the second quarter ended June 30, 2015 was E600 million, compared to E39 million for the same quarter ended June 30, 2014. 
 
Net interest income for the second quarter ended June 30, 2015 was E1.51 billion, compared to E1.44 billion for the same quarter ended June 30, 2014. 
 
Profit for the six months ended June 30, 2015 was E1.14 billion compared to E351 million for the same period ended June 30, 2014. 
 
Net interest income for the six months ended June 30, 2015 was E3.06 billion, compared to E2.87 billion for the same period ended June 30, 2014. 
 
Gerrit Zalm, chairman of the managing board of ABN AMRO Group, said: "ABN AMRO continued to perform well in Q2 of 2015 following a good start in Q1. With net profit coming to EUR 600 million, Q2 was the most profitable quarter since the new bank was created in 2010. The 86% increase in the underlying net profit for Q2 2015 year-on-year was achieved on the back of an increase in the operating result and significantly lower impairments."
